329: Position Overview: Community Behavioral Health (CBH) seeks an Instructional Designer to join their HR team. This role will work closely with subject matter experts and other stakeholders to design and develop engaging, effective learning materials for our employees. The ideal candidate will have experience with instructional design methodologies, multimedia development tools, and learning management systems. The goal is to expedite learning curves, intensify the effectiveness of training efforts, and increase the ease of learners acquiring knowledge, skills, and competencies. The instructional Designer will report to the Director of Learning and Development and play a key role in enhancing learning and development initiatives that support CBH's organizational goals. Essential Functions : Act as a subject matter expert in instructional design, working independently within established guidelines from leadership Collaborate with subject matter experts, HR colleagues, and business stakeholders to understand learning needs and create engaging and impactful learning solutions, including eLearning, ILT, virtual training, self-paced training, micro-learning, videos, infographics, support guides, job aids, and assessments tailored to the needs of different learners and business units Engage with business units to consult on and facilitate the planning, design, and delivery of learning solutions that meet learning needs, including storyboarding, scripting, and determining optimal content delivery methods Apply knowledge of adult learning theory and instructional design to create modern blended learning solutions that align with an employee development plan and CBH priorities Ensure learning programs align with organization goals, review training materials, and select the best delivery format for each program Identify learning objectives, performance outcomes, and evaluative strategies to measure the effectiveness of instruction Create effective assessments that can demonstrate learner mastery, using various evaluation methods to measure knowledge retention and application Continuously evaluate and improve the effectiveness of learning solutions based on feedback and data analysis Other duties as assigned Position Requirements: Bachelor's degree required in Instructional Design, Education, Human Resources, or related field; Master's degree preferred Minimum 2 years professional experience designing custom instructional and other solutions that support organizational learning needs Proficiency in Articulate 360 preferred or other learning content authoring software Strong foundation in adult learning theory and experience with advanced learning methodologies, frameworks, and technologies Minimum 2 years learning project management experience with demonstrated ability of critical thinking, problem solving, managing multiple and changing priorities Covid-19 Vaccine Requirement: The safety and well-being of our candidates, our people, and their families continues to be a top priority. Subject to applicable law, please be aware that CBH requires all employees to be fully vaccinated as a condition of employment.
